skos:ConceptScheme.dc:description: This vocabulary describes explanatory/descriptive/classifying information that annotates (highlights) significant periods and locations from the associated PITHIA resource, most commonly a Data Collection. Unlike Data Collection, Annotation admits the temporal/spatial extents, i.e., it includes specific time and location attributes. Annotations are compiled in a list (in a tabular form), with each line having a timestamp and then some other properties (category classifiers, ratings, evaluations, free-text comments.)

skos:Concept.skos:definition: A list of events: significant occurrences of defined categories in the physical world, such as solar flares, coronal mass ejections, geomagnetic storms, volcano eruptions, etc. The data provider manages the list: most importantly, new events are appended to the list as they occur.
A list of times when an instrument operation or a numerical model computation is adversely affected, resulting in missing or corrupted measurement/model data.

A list of prominent, persistent, distinctive data subsets from the underlying Data Collection in a specific category of their characteristics that make each feature stand out from otherwise unremarkable typical behavior.
